author.bio:
Nikki Thomas is a marketing communications strategist with more than ten years of experience planning and executing multi-channel projects for non-profit, education, and Fortune 100 clients. With a background in brand strategy and project management, she’s passionate about building alignment and crafting thoughtful plans that focus on the intersection of business and user needs. Her professional highlights include managing interactive environmental installations, augmented reality mobile sales tools, and enterprise-scale multisite networks for business and education. 

As a Business Development lead for Modern Tribe, Nikki works with clients of all sizes to shape vision into scope and get project teams started on a path to clear, measurable outcomes and celebrated wins.

wordpressPost.title: Meet Modern Tribe, WPCampus 2019 Sponsor
wordpressPost.excerpt: Modern Tribe is a digital agency for the modern university. We are so grateful to have this company sponsor WPCampus 2019.
wordpressPost.content:
This post is part of a series featuring sponsors from the WPCampus 2019 conference. This event would not be possible without the support of these amazing organizations. Be sure to check out their services, and say hello to them in Portland.

Modern Tribe is a digital agency for the modern university. We’ve created custom websites and multisite solutions for institutions like Harvard, Stanford, MIT, Columbia, CUNY, UCSF, and Boise State, in addition to Silicon Valley startups and Fortune 500 giants. Recognized hands-down as one of the top WordPress agencies, our partnerships have earned Webby Awards and a CASE Award of Excellence.

You may also know us as the team behind The Events Calendar, a suite of open-source event management tools used by hundreds of higher ed campuses across the country. Modern Tribe is proud to support the open source community through organizations like WPCampus and ongoing resources at www.wpforhighered.com.

WPCampus 2019 takes place July 25-29, 2019, on the campus of Lewis and Clark College in Portland, Oregon. It’s three days filled with sessions, workshops, networking, and social events—all focused on using WordPress in higher education.

Can’t make it to the event? Check out the 2019 watch page to livestream sessions.
